alert.note: Alert for Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 2:16PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Marion County through 300 PM EDT... At 214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Inverness Highlands North, or 11 miles northeast of Beverly Hills, moving southwest at 5 mph. Another developing storm was near Romeo moving southwest 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rainbow Lakes Estates, Dunnellon and Romeo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
